title: Design & Code: Learn Enough WordPress to Get By w/ Marco Cabrera

location.name: Crews Center for Entrepreneurship, 2nd Floor - University of Memphis

summary: WordPress powers a massive chunk of the web, but it can be a 'black box' until you know where to look. Join Marco Cabrera for a solid foundation on how the platform actually works under the hood, from themes and plugins to custom code and security.

description.whoIsThisFor: This session is for new users, aspiring developers, or anyone who has ever felt frustrated by a WordPress site they didn't know how to fix. Our goal is to move you from 'guessing' to 'knowing' how to manage the platform confidently.

agenda.details: Grab some food, say hello, and get to know others in the room.

Learn Enough WordPress to Get By

We aren't just going to look at the dashboard; we’re going to talk about how the pieces fit together so you can troubleshoot, edit, and secure a site. 

Key topics include:
• Admin & Architecture: Navigating the backend.
• Themes & Plugins: Understanding the difference and how to vet them effectively.
• When Tools Aren't Enough: Using HTML, CSS, and JS to customize when builders hit a wall.
• Routing & Structure: Finding where your data lives and how URLs work.
• Security: Essential practices for locking down a site.
• AI Assistance: Using AI and system prompts to help you troubleshoot and write custom snippets in real-time.
We'll wind down with conversation, connection, and appreciation for our attendees and speaker. We'll also give some shoutouts for upcoming events and snap a group photo.
